title: Filter chips
summary: Filter chips allow users to narrow down the data they want to see on the page.
preamble: The filter chip lets users narrow down visible content by selecting or removing specific filters. It helps refine results without navigating away from the page.
anatomy-details:
1.  Chips container
    
2.  Label text
    
3.  Trailing icon (selected)
    
4.  Icon button remove
    
5.  Leading icon

overview.title: Variants
overview.section-content:
The filter chip component comes in two variants, each supporting a different stage of the filtering experience:

*   **Selectable** – The default state, displaying only a label. Use this variant when presenting available filter options. When selected the chips updates to show a checkmark icon alongside the label, indicating an active filter.
    
*   **Removable** – Used to represent an applied filter. This chip includes a label and a close (×) icon, allowing users to remove the filter with a single click or tap.

overview.title: Example
overview.section-content:
If a user has accounts in three countries, only those three countries should be shown as filter chips. If they have accounts in just one country, there's no need to show a country filter at all.   
To improve clarity and support informed decisions, display the number of results each selected filter will return. This gives users immediate feedback on how their choices are narrowing or broadening the data set.

overview.title: Do's and don'ts
overview.section-content:
*   use a slide-out modal when there are many filter categories or options.
    
*   provide relevant, predefined options to make filtering easier.
    
*   allow multiple selections where it makes sense.
    
*   Make it easy for users to select, unselect, or clear all filters.

columns.title: Don´t
columns.content: *   place the filter options directly in the content area if there are too many categories or filters — use a slide-out modal instead to keep the interface clean and manageable.
